Breastfeeding can prevent the ovaries from releasing an egg. This method doesn't cost anything, but it is only effective when all 3 of these are true:

  1. Your baby is less than 6-months old.
  2. You haven't had your menstruation since giving birth.
  3. You are giving your baby only breastmilk, and feeding it whenever it is hungry, day and night, with no more than 6 hours between feedings. Your baby doesn't sleep through the night without feeding.

Use another method of family planning that is safe with breastfeeding as soon as any of the above aren't true.
